main event: A 43-pound chunk of ice plummeted from the sky and fell on a farm near Toccoa, Georgia on October 7, 1959.
interesting points: The origin of the ice was baffling to both scientists and ordinary citizens.
The ice was analyzed by the U.S. Geological Survey, the National Bureau of Standards, and the U.S. Weather Bureau.
The report concluded that the ice was formed when drinking water leaked from a commercial airplane, froze at 22,000 feet, and then dropped when the plane descended.
The report included 44 pages of findings, as well as diagrams and pictures.
The congressman who released the report noted that the press had been 'hounding' the Smithsonian for information about the ice and felt that something was being withheld.
